name: Growth in New Users
about: Growing the number of new API users is pretty obvious.  That is what we all want.  But it needs to be listed on your API evangelism strategy so you think about it constantly, ask it regularly and constantly innovate how you will attract new developers.

name: Growth in Existing User API Usage
about: Sometimes the real growth in API usage comes from helping existing users maximize existing potential, rather than just finding new users. Growth in existing user base should also be part of any evangelism strategy.

name: Brand Awareness
about: alt=
width=
align=

/>

n

One of the top reasons for designing, deploying and managing an active APIs is increase awareness of your brand.  

n

When first hearing about APIs many companies first concern is regarding control over their brand--feeling they might lose control over their brand in a programmatic world.  

n

With the right brand strategy for your API, you can effectively use your API to actually increase brand awareness and not hurt it.  

n

While evangelizing your API, think of how you can effectively package your brand to be part of your developers experience in a non-intrusive way.

n

Your brand needs to be ubiquitous across your evangelism efforts, in addition to being an essential part of your API developer portal community--properly guiding your developers in alignment with your overall brand marketing.

name: Fresh Engagement
about: >Emailing new developers who have registered weekly to see what their immediate needs are, while their registration is fresh in their minds.

name: Active User Engagement
about:
> Where we reach out to existing, active users of your API and find out what they need.  We profile them, including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and pull any profile information.  Grade and categorize each developer.n
    n
n

name: Historical Engagement
about: >Emailing historical active and / or inactive developers to engage and understand what their needs are and would make them active or increase activity.

name: Social Engagement
about: >When emailing any developer, using Rapportive we establish any URL, Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn profile they have and reach out via these networks.

name: Projects
about: >Establishing of editorial assembly line of technical projects that can feed blog stories, how-tos, samples and Github libraries.

name: Stories
about: >Writing, editing and posting of stories derived from projects, with SEO and API area support by design.

name: Syndication
about: >Syndication to Tumblr, Blogger and other relevant blogging sites.

name: Competition Monitoring
about:
> Evaluation of regular activity of competitors.n
    n
n

name: Industry Monitoring
about: >Evaluation of relevant topics and trends of overall industry.

name: Project & Developer Sites
about: >Identifying of relevant project sites like Elance and ODesk, and targeting developers who may be suited for engagement.

name: Keywords
about: >Established a list of keywords to use when searching for topics at search engines, QA, forums, social bookmarking and social networks.

name: City Targeting
about: >Target specific markets in cities that make sense to your evangelism strategy.

name: Formal Studies
about: Conduct formal studies in the sector you are targeting, and potentially new business sectors--share internally or possibly with partners and the public.

name: Forum Conversations
about: >Responding to forum activity in a timely and engaging way.

name: Forum Posting
about: >Generating forum activity by anonymous posters or officially with common problems and questions faced throughout community as well as open landscape.

name: Email Coordination
about:
> Regular coordination, relaying of support issues with central [Client Name] support.n
    n
n

name: Email Needs Tracking
about:
> Deriving of common support requests to drive API and API area roadmap.n
    n
n

name: Github Repository
about: >Managing of code sample Gists, official code libraries and any samples, starter kits or other code samples generated through projects.

name: Github Relationship
about: >Managing of followers, forks, downloads and other potential relationships via Github.

name: QA Profile Maintenance
about:
> Ensure that profile on Quora and Stack Overflow are active.n
    n
n

name: Stack Exchange
about:
> Regular trolling of Stack Exchange / Stack Overflow and responding to relevant [Client Name] or industry related questions.n
    n
n

name: Quora
about: ><span><span id=
>Regular trolling of Quora and responding to relevant [Client Name] or industry related questions.

name: QA Seeding
about: >Seeding of questions by anonymous 3rd party profiles for relevant topics.

name: LinkedIn
about: >Setup of new API specific LinkedIn profile page who will follow developers and other relevant users for engagement.  Posting of all API evangelism activities.

name: Google Plus
about: >Setup of new API specific Google+ company.  Posting of all API evangelism activities and management of friends.

name: Hacker News
about: >Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to Hacker News, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.

name: StumbleUpon
about: >Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to StumbleUpon, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.

name: Reddit
about: >Social bookmarking of all relevant API evangelism activities as well as relevant industry landscape topics to Reddit, to keep a fair and balanced profile, as well as network and user engagement.

name: Roadmap
about:
> Provide regular roadmap feedback based upon developer outreach and feedback.n
    n
n

name: Activity By Group
about:
> Summary and highlights from weekly activity within the each area of API evangelism strategy.n
    n
n

name: New Registrations
about: >Historical and weekly accounting of new developer registrations across APis.

name: Volume of Calls
about: >Historical and weekly accounting of API calls per API.

name: Hackathons
about: >What hackathons are coming up in 30, 90, 120 days? Which would should be sponsored, attended, etc.

name: Meetups
about: >What are the best meetups in target cities? Are there different formats that would best meet our goals? Are there any sponsorship or speaking opportunities?

name: Conferences
about: >What are the top conferences occurring that we can participate in or attend--pay attention to call for papers of relevant industry events.

name: Storytelling
about: >Telling stories of an API isn’t just something you do externally, what stores need to be told internally to make sure an API initiative is successful.

name: Participation
about: >It is very healthy to include other people from across the company in API operations. How can we include people from other teams in API evangelism efforts.

name: Reporting
about: >Sometimes providing regular numbers and reports to key players internally can help keep operations running smooth. What reports can we produce?

name: Getting Started
about: >Evolution of getting started page when relevant based upon API and network changes, and relevant developer feedback.

name: Documentation
about: >Enhancement and addition to API documentation based upon project development and active developer engagement and feedback

name: Code Samples
about: >Establish new code samples that can be used within API documentation pages, maintain them as API evolves.

name: Twitter
about: >Setup of new API specific Twitter account.  Tweeting of all API evangelism activity, relevant industry landscape activity, discover new followers and engage with followers.

name: Facebook
about: >Setup of new API specific Facebook company.  Posting of all API evangelism activities and management of friends.

name: Stories
about: >Deriving of stories for blog derived from forum activity, and the actual needs of developers.

name: Product Hunt
about: Product Hunt is a place to share the latest tech creations, providing an excellent format for API providers to share details about their new API offerings.
